item.title: Bushes falling onto street, 9th June
item.description:
Hi, The bushes/trees on the west side of Pitfield Street, closer to Shoreditch/Old St, are in need of pruning. They are falling onto the street and in the way of cars and bicycles. Thanks, Shane
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree between 24 and 26 Ravensbourne Avenue BR20BP is overhanging driveways and highways and needs pruning, 9th June
item.description:
The tree between 24 and 26 Ravensbourne Avenue requires serious pruning/ cutting back. The branches are now touching my car when I enter/exit the drive and are also seriously overhanging the pavement and highway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme Noise when rubbish is being picked up by the council, 9th June
item.description:
I have not been able to sleep every time there is a rubbish pick up truck in the morning. It extremely loud, especially as the street is cobbled stones. It also happens twice a week which makes it very noticeable. Thank you!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Institute Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weed in green bags, 9th June
item.description:
The street was weeded 3 weeks ago and left in these green disposal bags outside a few of the houses on Conifer Gardens. I appreciate it if these can be cleared up ASAP. Thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Conifer Gardens, Streatham Hill, London

item.title: Pavement between 188/190 Goldhurst Tce, NW6 3HN is almost totally blocked by overgrown hedge, 9th June
item.description:
The hedge between 188/190 Goldhurst Tce is totally overgrown to the extent that it has blocked almost the full width of the pavement requiring pedestrians to walk in the road. The shrubbery is hanging at a level of around 1m or less across almost the full width of the footway. This is made more dangerous by there being dropped kerbs nearby, with uneven slopes. Please can it urgently be cut back to align with the property boundaries with the footway- no more encroachment please for the sake of pedestrian safety. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 184, Goldhurst Terrace, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping r/o 159 Penhill Rd, Bexley, 9th June
item.description:
Building materials/rubble in split bags in alley r/o 159 Penhill Rd Bexley. Caller said that he reported this on 6th May but rubbish is still there. He says that this blocking access to his garage at the r/o 159 Penhill Rd - he is requesting that this is removed asap!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Penhill Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin left on pavement, 9th June
item.description:
This bin is always on the pavement. Its either infront of the car on the pavement or blocking the pavement where pushchairs and wheelchairs cant get pass. The owner of the bin always leaving the bin outside of the property cauing nuisance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knapmill Road, Southend, London
